thread.title: Daniel Craig and David Oyelowo to star in ‘Othello'
thread.title_full: Daniel Craig and David Oyelowo to star in ‘Othello' - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Daniel Craig and David Oyelowo to star in ‘Othello'
text:
Mike Marsland/WireImage Daniel Craig will make his Off-Broadway debut in "Othello." Enlarge Kevin Mazur/WireImage David Oyelowo will play the title role in "Othello." Enlarge Daniel Craig, l., and David Oyelowo will star in "Othello" in 2016.
Talk about a beast with two backs!
Hollywood’s James Bond, Daniel Craig, and “Selma” standout David Oyelowo will headline New York Theatre Workshop’s production of “Othello” next fall.
Craig will play Iago opposite Oyelowo in the title role of the Shakespeare classic big-boned tragedy.
“I’m eager to see what these original, creative artists come up with in,” said NYTW artistic director James Nivola.
The announcement precedes Craig’s fourth outing as superagent 007 in “Spectre,” which opens Nov. 6.
Craig made his Broadway debut in 2009 in the cop drama “A Steady Rain.” In 2013, he returned to Broadway for Harold Pinter’s “Betrayal.”
In 2007, Oyelowo (“Selma”) played the title role in an Off-Broadway production of “Prometheus Bound.”
Tony winner Sam Gold (“Fun Home”) will direct. Further casting will be announced.
jdziemianowicz@nydailynews.com
